# Arpeggio: Minor 7b5 in C#

## Brief Presentation
An arpeggio is a musical technique where the notes of a chord are played one after the other, rather than simultaneously. The minor 7b5 arpeggio in the key of C# consists of the notes C# (root), E (minor third), G (diminished fifth), and B (minor seventh). This arpeggio is also known as a half-diminished arpeggio.

## Notes and Intervals
- C# (Root)
- E (Minor third)
- G (Diminished fifth)
- B (Minor seventh)

The intervals in the C# minor 7b5 arpeggio are a minor third, diminished fifth, and minor seventh.

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Minor 7b5 arpeggio in C# is commonly used in jazz, fusion, and other genres that incorporate complex harmonies and melodic lines. It adds a sophisticated and somewhat dissonant flavor to a piece of music, providing tension that can be resolved in various ways.
